snippet: The Iraqi government said it had closed the prison, the site of an abuse scandal during the American occupation, because of fears that it could be overrun by Sunni insurgents.
abstract: Iraq shuts down Abu Ghraib prison, site of notorious prisoner abuse scandal during American occupation of Iraq, because of fears that it could be overrun by Sunni insurgents; closing underscores rapid deterioration of security in Iraq since beginning of 2014.

byline.original: By DURAID ADNAN and TIM ARANGO
byline.contributor: Duraid Adnan reported from Baghdad, and Tim Arango from Istanbul.

lead_paragraph: The Iraqi government said it had closed the prison, the site of an abuse scandal during the American occupation, because of fears that it could be overrun by Sunni insurgents.

headline.main: Iraq Shuts Down the Abu Ghraib Prison, Citing Security Concerns
headline.print_headline: Iraq Shuts Down the Abu Ghraib Prison, Citing Security Concerns
